item.description:
Avengers 4 Director Joe Russo Just Hinted That Chris Evans' Cap May Not Be Done Yet  Gizmodo Australia

Back in October everyone (ourselves included) made a big deal of Chris Evans' remarks that he was done with Captain America. Well, that may have been ...

The Russo Brothers Have Mastered Avengers 4 Trolling  Kotaku Australia

The Russo brothers appeared on stage at the Game Awards to make a Thanos joke and give an award to Fortnite. Their appearance at the Game Awards was ...

item.title: Things You Can Do While Waiting For The Avengers 4 Trailer To Drop - Gizmodo Australia

Things You Can Do While Waiting For The Avengers 4 Trailer To Drop  Gizmodo Australia

Yesterday, Disney released a trailer for Artemis Fowl, a movie coming out in August. Last week, the studio released a trailer for The Lion King, a movie coming ...

item.title: 'Avengers: Endgame' trailer is finally here - CNN
item.description:
'Avengers: Endgame' trailer is finally here  CNN

Much to the excitement of fans, the trailer for the fourth film in the "Avengers" franchise has arrived. The upcoming film, "Avengers: Endgame," features Iron Man, played by Robert Downey Jr., Captain America, played by Chris Evans, and Black Widow, played by Scarlett Johansson. Iron Man is shown floating through space with insufficient oxygen after being left on Titan. The film, directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, also includes popular characters Dr. Strange [Benedict Cumberbatch], Spider-Man [Tom Holland], Thor [Chris Hemsworth], Hulk [Mark Ruffalo], Ant-Man [Paul Rudd] and Black Panther [...

item.title: Deadpool attempts to upstage Avengers: Endgame trailer with spoof website - The Independent
item.description:
Deadpool attempts to upstage Avengers: Endgame trailer with spoof website  The Independent

Following months of anticipation, Marvel Studios finally released the trailer for Avengers: Endgame. Yet, despite an Earth-shattering number of people watching the trailer, Deadpool somehow managed to upstage his Marvel counterparts. Moments after the trailer went online, the website AvengersEndgame.com went live, with many fans presuming the website would link to more information on the fourth Avengers movie. However, the URL leads fans to another website: the Fox Studio page for Once Upon a Time a Deadpool, the soon-to-be-released child-friendly version of Deadpool 2. Although a marketing...

item.title: ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Trailer Takes a Mournful Approach to Sequels - The New York Times
item.description:
‘Avengers: Endgame’ Trailer Takes a Mournful Approach to Sequels  The New York Times

The Marvel Cinematic Universe bookended this week with trailers, dropping the second clip for “Captain Marvel” during “Monday Night Football,” then releasing the first look at “Avengers: Endgame” on Friday. And that may not be all: The first trailer for “Spider-Man: Far from Home” is expected to be released on Saturday. After introducing Brie Larson as Carol Danvers, a.k.a. Captain Marvel, in September, Marvel rolled-out a follow-up explaining that she’s part of the Kree, a race of noble heroes in a seemingly endless war with the evil Skrull empire. The new clip also provided a peek at Anne...

item.title: ‘Avengers 4; Endgame’ Trailer Drops for Hotly Anticipated Sequel - The Daily Beast
item.description:
‘Avengers 4; Endgame’ Trailer Drops for Hotly Anticipated Sequel  The Daily Beast

Mario Anzuoni/Reuters, Who lives? Who dies? The hotly anticipated Avengers 4 trailer arrived Friday morning. Tony Stark, aka Iron Man, is shown broken and alone, adrift in space after Thanos’ victory that wiped out half of the living creatures in the universe. Here it is: ,,,, Read it at YouTube

item.title: Avengers 4 finally releases first trailer - The Advertiser
item.description:
Avengers 4 finally releases first trailer  The Advertiser

Let’s all say it together again: trailer drop. Specifically, Avengers 4 — which we now know will be called Avengers: Endgame. The first trailer is finally here and in its first six hours, it’s already clocked up 19 million views on Marvel’s YouTube channel alone. Putting aside the fact that Endgame should be End Game, the name and what’s teased in the trailer confirms what Marvel Studios head honcho Kevin Feige has been saying for a while — this movie, the 22nd Marvel Cinematic Universe, will mark the end of an era for the MCU. Many of the original MCU heroes such as Captain America and Iro...

item.title: Stop What You're Doing Because the 'Avengers 4' Trailer Is Finally Here - Men's Health
item.description:
Stop What You're Doing Because the 'Avengers 4' Trailer Is Finally Here  Men's Health

Prepare for the end. YouTube It's finally here. On Friday, Marvel released the long-awaited trailer for Avengers 4, a.k.a. Avengers: Endgame. The two-and-a-half-minute trailer is emotional as hell—which makes sense, given it picks up where Avengers: Infinity War left off. In case you missed it, Thanos, destroyed half of all living things in the universe, including a few of our favorite superheroes. In Avengers: Endgame, we'll see the remaining good guys finish their fight against Thanos—and knowing Marvel, it's going to be epic as hell. Avengers: Endgame is slated for an April 2019 release.

item.title: Avengers: Endgame – title and trailer for new Marvel movie revealed - The Guardian
item.description:
Avengers: Endgame – title and trailer for new Marvel movie revealed  The Guardian

The trailer for the fourth Avengers film, Avengers: Endgame, has been launched on to the internet. Related: Avengers 4 trailer: five things we learned about Marvel's Endgame movie Conceived as a direct sequel to, and filmed at the same time as, Avengers: Infinity War, the film is due to pick up at the stunning finish of its predecessor, as supervillain Thanos appears to have wiped out half of all life (as well a considerable numbers of superheroes) after activating the Infinity Gauntlet. Anticipation for the film is huge, after Infinity War became the highest grossing film of 2018 (though B...

item.title: The Stars Missing From ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Trailer - International Business Times
item.description:
The Stars Missing From ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Trailer  International Business Times

The “Avengers 4” trailer finally came out, but it didn’t show too much. The “Avengers: Endgame,” as it is officially titled, video didn’t even include all of the survivors of Thanos’ snap. The trailer does not show Pepper Potts (Gwyneth Paltrow). Iron Man is recording a message for her, but we don’t see her. However, fans know that she was working on set for “Avengers 4.” Her behind-the-scenes photos even make Marvel fans thing that she might take on a superhero persona. Okoye (Danai Gurira) also isn’t around. She is probably in Wakanda helping keep the peace after her king was caught in th...

item.title: Avengers 4 trailer: five things we learned about Marvel's Endgame movie - The Guardian
item.description:
Avengers 4 trailer: five things we learned about Marvel's Endgame movie  The Guardian

For a mega-blockbuster that had one of the most convoluted build-ups in the history of cinema, Avengers: Infinity War opted to end on one of the biggest audience bummers since The Empire Strikes Back. Spoiler warning: big purple bad dude Thanos succeeded in wiping out literally half of the entire universe, including a considerable proportion of the Marvel heroes fans had grown to love over the course of an eventful movie-going decade. So where do you go from there? Today’s new trailer for Avengers: Endgame has a few suggestions, squashed into two and a half minutes. Here’s what we learned. ...

item.title: ‘Avengers 4’ Trailer Reveals Official Title In Ominous First Look - HuffPost
item.description:
‘Avengers 4’ Trailer Reveals Official Title In Ominous First Look  HuffPost

If you were expecting unicorns and rainbows for the eagerly awaited “Avengers 4” trailer, you’ve come to the wrong place. Marvel released the first look at “Avengers: Endgame” (yep, that’s the title) early Friday, and Robert Downey Jr.’s Tony Stark/Iron Man got things off to a dark start by intoning, “Part of the journey is the end.” The sense of foreboding doesn’t lighten up much from there, as others in the Marvel gang issue ominous proclamations about the battle ahead in the perfect appetite-whetter for the film’s opening on May 3. Scott Lang (Paul Rudd), aka Ant-Man, shows up to provide...

item.title: 'Avengers: Endgame' Trailer Reveals New Release Date, Hints At Major Reversal - Forbes
item.description:
'Avengers: Endgame' Trailer Reveals New Release Date, Hints At Major Reversal  Forbes

The long-awaited trailer for Avengers 4 finally arrived this morning, revealing the name of the movie and the first official footage. But that’s not all we got from Avengers: Endgame this morning. The trailer’s premiere was accompanied by a new release date, as well as the first teaser poster for the film that will conclude this era of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. See the poster, watch the trailer, and read all about the date-change — plus, is this really the final title of the movie, or might Marvel have one last trick up their sleeve? Be warned, mild possible-spoiler discussions ahead! ...

item.title: What The 'Avengers: Endgame' Trailer Tells Us - Forbes
item.description:
What The 'Avengers: Endgame' Trailer Tells Us  Forbes

Robert Downey Jr. arrives at the world premiere of “Avengers: Infinity War” on Monday, April 23, 2018, in Los Angeles. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) The long-awaited Avengers 4 trailer finally dropped this morning, complete with the hitherto secret, supposedly spoiler-ish title, “Endgame.” Hmm. Doesn’t seem like there’s a huge spoiler in there, other than the fact that this film will finally wrap up the MCU plotline that has unfolded over the last decade – but we already knew that. This is a bleak, subdued superhero trailer, opening with Tony Stark lamenting his fate, alone and adri...

item.title: 'Avengers: Endgame' Trailer Hints At Major Off-Screen Death - HuffPost
item.description:
'Avengers: Endgame' Trailer Hints At Major Off-Screen Death  HuffPost

The first promo video for “Avengers: Endgame” (aka “Avengers 4”) is finally here, and the obvious question has presented itself: Wakanda trailer is this? On the surface, the teaser offers a quick summary of where the superhero megafranchise stands after “Infinity War”: Thanos (Josh Brolin) wiped out half the universe, and now it looks like the other half has fallen into a deep depression. Meanwhile, Thanos is just out there farming. My fave part of the #AvengersEndGame trailer was this little wink to Farmer Thanos. pic.twitter.com/KYkJkyUEsm — Dinosaur Dracula (@DinosaurDracula) December 7,...

item.title: Avengers 4 trailer: Shot-by-shot breakdown of Endgame teaser reveals Hawkeye's return, Shuri's fate, and Ant-Man - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4 trailer: Shot-by-shot breakdown of Endgame teaser reveals Hawkeye's return, Shuri's fate, and Ant-Man  The Independent

The long-awaited trailer for the fourth Avengers has been released, revealing the film’s official title: Avengers: Endgame. It's a brief teaser that seemingly plays its cards close to its chest, although there are some major revelations to be found, for those willing to put the clues together. Most importantly, there's a suggestion that there will, indeed, be a way to reverse "the snap" cause by Thanos, in which half of living beings in the universe ceased to exist. There's also the long-heralded return of a character who sat out Avengers: Infinity War for reasons previously unknown. The tr...

item.title: Avengers: Endgame trailer review: Marvel begins the search for Tony Stark on a sombre note - The Telegraph
item.description:
Avengers: Endgame trailer review: Marvel begins the search for Tony Stark on a sombre note  The Telegraph

After the calm, the storm. Such is the thrilling trajectory the Marvel Cinematic Universe would seem to be on with release of the cosmically-anticipated first trailer for the sequel to Avengers: Infinity War. The major bombshell is the movie's name. "Avengers: Endgame" is the big, brassy statement fans will have hoped for (though a few may have been holding out for the other rumoured moniker, Avengers: Annihilation). Equally striking is the tone of the new two and a half minute spot – serious with a vengeance and, apart from a surprise cameo by Paul Rudd as Ant-Man's alter-ego Scott Lang at...

item.title: Avengers 4: End Game release date, trailer, title, spoilers – everything we know so far about Infinity War 2 - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4: End Game release date, trailer, title, spoilers – everything we know so far about Infinity War 2  The Independent

Avengers: Infinity War brought about the destruction of the beloved superhero team. With Thanos looming large and half the Avengers turned to dust, anticipation for Avengers: End Game has reached fever pitch. Will Iron Man, Captain America and the remaining crew be able to put a stop to the Mad Titan? Can they bring back Spider-Man, Black Panther and Doctor Strange? Disney and Marvel have kept incredibly silent about the upcoming sequel, but small details have emerged thanks to tie-in toys, chatty actors and the occasional leak. Here’s everything we know about the fourth Avengers movie. Rel...

item.title: Avengers 4 trailer released as Infinity War sequel title revealed as End Game - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4 trailer released as Infinity War sequel title revealed as End Game  The Independent

The long-awaited trailer for the fourth Avengers has been released, revealing the film’s official title: Avengers: End Game. Watch the trailer above, which features the reappearance of Jeremy Renner‘s previously missing superhero Hawkeye. The trailer came accompanied with the message: “For those who have been here since the beginning. For those who have joined along the way. For the best fans in the Universe. This trailer is for you... “ Following the catastrophic events of Infinity War, the Avengers are at their lowest, with Tony Stark (AKA Iron Man) adrift in space. Thor, Captain America ...

item.title: Avengers: Endgame trailer: Captain America has one last plan to defeat Thanos - Vox.com
item.description:
Avengers: Endgame trailer: Captain America has one last plan to defeat Thanos  Vox.com

Marvel Avengers 4 a.k.a. Avengers: Endgame shows our heroes in the aftermath of Thanos’s wrath Marvel has finally released the first trailer for Avengers 4, now officially titled Avengers: Endgame. The film is the fourth and final chapter of the Avengers film franchise, and the capstone of the inaugural era of superhero movies set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The trailer shows the aftermath of the Avengers: Infinity War, as we see the heroes that Thanos didn’t vaporize — Iron Man, Captain America, Black Widow, and Thor, among others — begin to come to terms with what happened when half...

item.title: Captain Marvel trailer: Brie Larson finishes a war in space - The Telegraph
item.description:
Captain Marvel trailer: Brie Larson finishes a war in space  The Telegraph

It’s a bird, a plane, it’s definitely not Superman. Marvel Studios have released the new trailer for the highly anticipated superhero film Captain Marvel. Directed by Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck, it is the 21st film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and, crucially, the studio’s first solo female-led Marvel film. Brie Larson as Carol Danvers, aka Captain Marvel, in the upcoming Captain Marvel filmCredit: Marvel Studios The film takes place in the Nineties, long before Iron Man was a twinkle in Tony Stark’s eye, with Carol Danvers (Oscar winner Brie Larson) arriving on Earth chasing alien “Skrul...

item.title: ‘Avengers 4’ Moved To Earlier Release Date - International Business Times
item.description:
‘Avengers 4’ Moved To Earlier Release Date  International Business Times

The “Avengers 4” trailer as finally arrived, and it revealed more than just plot details and an official title. It revealed that, like “Avengers: Infinity War,” Marvel Studios will release the movie earlier than planned. Previously, “Avengers 4,” which is now officially titled “Avengers: Endgame,” was set to be released May 3, 2019. The trailer, however, ends by saying the movie will be out in April. The official poster for “Avengers: Endgame” reveals that the movie will hit theaters on April 26, 2019. The release date falls on the same weekend that “Infinity War” was released last year. Of...

item.title: 'Avengers: Engdame' Trailer: Marvel And Disney Try To Fool Us Twice - Forbes
item.description:
'Avengers: Engdame' Trailer: Marvel And Disney Try To Fool Us Twice  Forbes

‘Avengers: Endgame’ Dread it, run from it… destiny still arrives. Destiny, in this case, is the first teaser trailer for Avengers 4, which arrives after a slight “we can’t take a stock bump if the NYSE is closed due to George H.W. Bush’s funeral” delay. First off, the movie is now called… Avengers: Endgame. The trailer is very much a teaser, offering a title and a new release date (April 26, 2019, in line with Infinity War’s earlier launch date) but otherwise little in the way of how long it has been or what happened when Thanos wiped out half the universe. But the title, and Steve’s final ...

item.title: Marvel Cinematic Universe timeline: How to watch every MCU movie and TV show in chronological order - The Independent
item.description:
Marvel Cinematic Universe timeline: How to watch every MCU movie and TV show in chronological order  The Independent

With Avengers: Infinity War, the Marvel Cinematic Universe has now been rolling forward for exactly 10 years. As these movies have gone on, they’ve also become ever-more interlinked, featuring regular cameos, references, and Easter Eggs to other instalments. For newcomers to superhero movies — perhaps those who have become absorbed in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) following Black Panther — the amount of material to watch can be overwhelming. But for those wanting to persevere, there are two watching orders. Really, you should probably watch these movies in release order, starting the ...

item.title: Why Randy Rainbow, The Muppets, And The Avengers Should Host The Oscars - Forbes
item.description:
Why Randy Rainbow, The Muppets, And The Avengers Should Host The Oscars  Forbes

No, you’re not high and I’m not high, you read the headline correctly. Apparently the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences had a tough time finding anyone who wanted to host the 91st Academy Awards ceremony on February 24. (Because as we all know, people in Hollywood abhor high-profile self-promotional engagements in front of film industry elites and one of the largest audiences in the world.) But yesterday, Kevin Hart was announced as this year’s Oscar host. That still doesn’t solve the problem of finding hosts for future Oscar telecasts, since the same questions will rear their ugl...

item.title: “Avengers 4” trailer highlights series favorite: Hawkeye - Fast Company
item.description:
“Avengers 4” trailer highlights series favorite: Hawkeye  Fast Company

What: The fiendishly anticipated trailer for the next Avengers movie. Who: Infinity War directors Anthony and Joe Russo, screenwriters Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely, and of course series lead Jeremy Renner. Why we care: He’s back, baby! It may have taken half of Earth’s population getting wiped out for him to be needed, but Marvel’s purest hero, Hawkeye, returns in Avengers: Endgame. The trailer picks up in the aftermath of Thanos’ Promises Made, Promises Kept-style leadership, with the remaining Avengers scattered and brooding all across the galaxy. They need not brood for long, t...

item.title: Understanding Captain Marvel And Its New Trailer - Forbes
item.description:
Understanding Captain Marvel And Its New Trailer  Forbes

Captain Marvel Yesterday Disney dropped a new poster for the forthcoming Captain Marvel, and a short time ago the studio finally released its second trailer. We know the heroine has a huge role in Avengers 4, but who IS Captain Marvel? Who are the film’s shapeshifting villains? What do you need to know? The Complicated History of ‘Captain Marvel’ The character name of ‘Captain Marvel’ has a curious history due to rights issues between Marvel and DC. What you may not know is that both comics imprints have characters named ‘Captain Marvel’… and both have forthcoming movies. (DC’s Shazam film,...

item.title: Two new Marvel trailers reportedly arriving this week - The Telegraph
item.description:
Two new Marvel trailers reportedly arriving this week  The Telegraph

Christmas seems to have come early for Marvel fans with the upcoming release of trailers for the highly anticipated Captain Marvel and Avengers 4. The rumours had been growing over the last few weeks regarding the possibility of both trailers being released, despite Marvel not yet having made an official announcement. However, entertainment pundits such as John Campea and Daniel RPK tweeted on Sunday that Marvel Studios would debut the new trailer for Captain Marvel at halftime during the Monday Night Football matchup. Campea and Daniel RPK have since deleted their tweets, but Marvel Studio...

item.title: "Familiar" Channels Experiences Of "Black Panther" And "Walking Dead" Star Danai Gurira - Forbes
item.description:
"Familiar" Channels Experiences Of "Black Panther" And "Walking Dead" Star Danai Gurira  Forbes

Danai Gurira speaks at “The Walking Dead” panel New York Comic Con. (AP Photo/Steve Luciano) Danai Gurira is not only a badass on The Walking Dead, the upcoming Avengers 4 and the Oscar buzz-generating Black Panther, she’s also a celebrated playwright. To that end, one of Gurira’s earlier works, “Familiar,” is getting a resurgence in the Heartland. Chicago’s famed Steppenwolf Theatre has rebooted Gurira’s comedy-drama about a Zimbabwean-American family and their push-pull of accepting American life while also paying homage to memories of life in Africa. At its surface, this story is about ...

item.title: 'Avengers 4' gets a title, trailer and new release date - The Associated Press
item.description:
'Avengers 4' gets a title, trailer and new release date  The Associated Press

LOS ANGELES (AP) — The fourth "Avengers" movie finally has a title. Marvel Studios and the Walt Disney Co. said Friday that the highly anticipated, and closely guarded, conclusion to the "Infinity War" saga will be called "Avengers: Endgame." The studios also released the first trailer for the film, in which Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow character explains that Thanos really did erase half the population. "Avengers: Infinity War" ended on that cliffhanger as many of Marvel's superheroes dissolved into the air. It went on to become the highest grossing film in the Marvel Cinematic Univers...

item.title: Captain Marvel trailer shows Brie Larson's superhero beating up an elderly woman (who's actually a Skrull) - The Independent
item.description:
Captain Marvel trailer shows Brie Larson's superhero beating up an elderly woman (who's actually a Skrull)  The Independent

The second trailer for Captain Marvel has landed, showcasing Brie Larson's superhero beating up an elderly woman (who's actually a shape-shifting villain called a Skrull). Annette Bening debuts as the unnamed Kree who saves Larson's character Carol Danvers, while Samuel L. Jackson returns as Nick Fury (now with two eyes). Set in the 1990s, official synopsis reads: "Based on the Marvel comic character first appearing in 1968, the story follows Carol Danvers as she becomes one of the universe’s most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races."...

item.title: Brie Larson And Tessa Thompson Talk Inclusion On Marvel Sets - International Business Times
item.description:
Brie Larson And Tessa Thompson Talk Inclusion On Marvel Sets  International Business Times

Captain Marvel and Valkyrie save the world on the big screen, and now they’re trying to help make the real world be a better place too. While speaking about the Time’s Up movement, actresses Brie Larson and Tessa Thompson criticized the lack of diversity on Marvel Studios’ crews. “Inclusion doesn’t happen by mistake,” Thompson told the Hollywood Reporter. “It’s also about creating pipelines where they don’t exist. Brie and I both work on Marvel films, and those are shot in Atlanta…” “There are not a ton of people of color on some of them, given how many people of color there are in Atlanta,...

item.title: “You were reborn”: Watch the epic new trailer for ‘Captain Marvel’ - NME Live
item.description:
“You were reborn”: Watch the epic new trailer for ‘Captain Marvel’  NME Live

"Your life began the day it nearly ended" Brie Larson as Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel The new trailer for Captain Marvel has been released, and it offers a telling glimpse of Carol Danvers’ transformation into the titular hero. The Marvel epic, which is set for release in March 2019, sees Oscar winner Brie Larson star as fighter pilot Danvers, who adopts superhuman powers when her DNA fuses with that of the powerful Kree alien race. In the latest trailer, we’re given another look at *that* moment of Danvers seemingly attacking an elderly woman. However, the attack makes a bit more sense whe...

item.title: Marvel Plans 'Master Of Kung Fu' As First Asian-Led Superhero Movie - Forbes
item.description:
Marvel Plans 'Master Of Kung Fu' As First Asian-Led Superhero Movie  Forbes

With the new Captain Marvel trailer dropping tonight during Monday Night Football and an Avengers 4 trailer expected mid-week, Marvel fans’ holiday spirits are lifting again after last week’s disappointing news that the Netflix series Daredevil is cancelled and the Marvel-Netflix shows will cease after next year’s final seasons of Jessica Jones and The Punisher. Today, there’s even more positive news for Marvel fans, as Deadline announced a Shang-Chi movie is fast-tracked by Marvel Studios, with David Callaham on scripting duties. This will be the first Asian-led superhero franchise from a ...

item.title: Avengers 4 trailer release date: First look at Infinity War sequel 'arriving this week' - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4 trailer release date: First look at Infinity War sequel 'arriving this week'  The Independent

Just a few days after being treated to a brand new Captain Marvel trailer, the world appears to be on the cusp of receiving its first look at Avengers 4. One week after fans were left disappointed when a theory suggesting it would be unveiled last week was disproved, reports have now “confirmed” the first look at the Infinity War follow-up will drop later this week, reportedlt a few days after planned due to the memorial for George HW Bush who died last week. The Grammy Award nominations announcement has also been pushed back so as not to coincide with the service. Considering the film is d...

item.title: Before We Get That 'Avengers 4,' Trailer, Here Are The 5 Best MCU Teasers - Forbes
item.description:
Before We Get That 'Avengers 4,' Trailer, Here Are The 5 Best MCU Teasers  Forbes

‘The Avengers’ We were supposed to get an Avengers 4 trailer this morning, but it was postponed by at least a day allegedly due to a “national day of mourning” for recently-departed George H.W. Bush. Not to be cynical, but Disney’s stock price can’t go up based on trailer release hype if the NYSE is closed for the day. While we patiently (?) wait for Walt Disney and Marvel to drop that promised Avengers 4 teaser, I wanted to take a glance at the previous teaser trailers/announcement trailers for the last ten years of the MCU. So, with no additional fuss or muss, here are my personal picks f...

item.title: Marvel reportedly working on its first Asian-led superhero movie - NME Live
item.description:
Marvel reportedly working on its first Asian-led superhero movie  NME Live

The studio is said to have fast-tracked a project around Shang-Chi, the master of kung fu Marvel Marvel is working on its first Asian-led superhero movie, according to reports. - Read more: Excelsior! Stan Lee’s 10 greatest Marvel creations – and how he found humanity in superhumans Shang-Chi is set to be the first film to feature an Asian protagonist in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and, according to Deadline, work on the project has now been fast-tracked. The titular superhero first appeared in the Marvel comic series in December 1973. He is the son of Fu Manchu and was raised in a compou...

item.title: Avengers 4 directors discuss chances of Deadpool and X-Men appearing in new Marvel film - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4 directors discuss chances of Deadpool and X-Men appearing in new Marvel film  The Independent

Avengers: Infinity War directing duo Joe and Anthony Russo believe that the X-Men and Deadpool will soon be seen in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. “I’m sure of it,” Joe Russo said, according to Deadline. “The acquisition of Fox is showing us where the future of the business is going to go.” The characters have previously not been able to appear alongside the likes of Iron Man, Hulk and Captain America because Fox – not Disney’s Marvel Studios – owned the rights to them. However, after the Disney and Fox merger finalises, that could all change. The best films of 2018 (so far) - 17 show all T...

item.title: Will The First 'Avengers 4' Trailer Answer These Three Burning Questions? - Forbes
item.description:
Will The First 'Avengers 4' Trailer Answer These Three Burning Questions?  Forbes

Don Cheadle, Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Anthony Mackie, Chadwick Boseman, Sebastian Stan, and Danai Gurira in ‘Avengers: Infinity War’ As much as I would have preferred that Walt Disney wait until after Captain Marvel (like after the end credits of Captain Marvel) to debut their first teaser trailer for Avengers 4, I’m not going to be too grouchy if the rumors are true and they follow their relatively standard MCU marketing schedule. To be fair, even if this trailer drops tomorrow (which I am now hearing it might not), it will have still debuted “later” than Avengers: Infinity War (No...

item.title: Brie Larson Gives Chris Hemsworth a Run for His Money With Thor's Hammer - Men's Health
item.description:
Brie Larson Gives Chris Hemsworth a Run for His Money With Thor's Hammer  Men's Health

Welcome to the Marvel Universe. Getty/Instagram Brie Larson has proven she'll fit right in with the rest of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The 29-year-old shared a video of herself on Instagram Sunday slamming down a 16-pound sledgehammer, and tagged—rightfully so—Thor star Chris Hemsworth. Larson's followers praised her for her strength in the comments section, writing, "Captain Marvel is the new Thor." Another said, "Love this!!!! I’d love to see Captain Marvel and Thor fighting beside each other." Hemsworth has played the Uru hammer-wielding god of thunder since 2011. Larson will be join...

item.title: Captain Marvel trailer: Who are the Skrulls and will they feature in Avengers 4? - The Independent
item.description:
Captain Marvel trailer: Who are the Skrulls and will they feature in Avengers 4?  The Independent

The new trailer for Captain Marvel has introduced us to the latest threat to the heroes of the Marvel Cinematic Universe: the Skrulls. In the comics, the Skrulls are a race of shape-shifting aliens intent on invading Earth, while also being engaged in a prolonged war with fellow extraterrestrials, the Kree. Captain Marvel, born Carol Danvers, is a human whose DNA has become fused with that of a Kree, resulting in her superpowers. The film suggests she doesn't remember her past on Earth. However, she knows a Skrull when she sees one, which explains why the trailers so far have featured Capta...

item.title: Shang-Chi: Marvel Cinematic Universe fast-tracking first Asian-led superhero franchise - The Independent
item.description:
Shang-Chi: Marvel Cinematic Universe fast-tracking first Asian-led superhero franchise  The Independent

The Marvel Cinematic Universe is adding another superhero to its crowded ensemble. Shang-Chi will become the studio's first Asian protagonist, with Chinese-American writer Dave Callahan on screenwriting duties. Created by Steven Englehart and Jim Starlin, Shang-Chi made his first appearance in December 1973 following the boom of martial arts films thanks to the success of Enter the Dragon. He’s the son of a China-based globalist who, after being raised in a reclusive compound, developed “unsurpassed skills” in kung fu. Read more - Avengers 4 trailer release date confirmed - Daredevil cast ‘...

item.title: New ‘Avengers 4’ Trailer Release Rumor - International Business Times
item.description:
New ‘Avengers 4’ Trailer Release Rumor  International Business Times

The “Avengers 4” trailer is pretty much the most highly-anticipated trailer of the year at this point, but it seems Marvel Studios will finally release the promo video this week. The “Avengers 4” trailer will premiere Wednesday morning, according to SuperBroMovies’ Daniel RPK. MCU Cosmic’s Jeremy Conrad has said that the source is legit. Fandango’s Erik Davis posted a teasing tweet after the “Captain Marvel” trailer announcement that has fans speculating he is hinting at the “Avengers 4” trailer release. Similarly, Peter Sciretta from /Film also tweeted that “the rumblings seem to be true” ...

item.title: Watch The New 'Captain Marvel' Trailer Here - Forbes
item.description:
Watch The New 'Captain Marvel' Trailer Here  Forbes

In 95 days, Marvel Studios’ next cosmic franchise blasts off in theaters on March 8th. But tonight, fans got their latest look at Brie Larson’s superhero persona in action, as the new trailer for Captain Marvel debuted. Writer-director duo Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck helm the film, which also stars Samuel L. Jackson as Nick Fury. The trailer is reportedly one of two from Marvel this week, with expectations that an Avengers 4 trailer will follow on Wednesday. Official poster for Marvel’s “Captain Marvel” Captain Marvel stars Larson as former Air Force pilot Carol Danvers, who becomes a warrior...

item.title: 'Captain Marvel' Trailer Shows What Makes Brie Larson's Carol Danvers A Hero - Forbes
item.description:
'Captain Marvel' Trailer Shows What Makes Brie Larson's Carol Danvers A Hero  Forbes

‘Captain Marvel’ We just got our second theatrical trailer for Captain Marvel thanks to Monday Night Football. As hoped/expected, this second sell has a bit more to offer than the unexpectedly cryptic first tease. No, it contains little in the way of Avengers 4 “clues,” just as Ant-Man and the Wasp’s marketing campaign had not a single explicit reference to Infinity War. Yes, the sell isn’t just “what makes her a hero” but also what makes Captain Marvel worth seeing beyond the customary “he” being a “she.” The trailer teases the notion that this 1990’s-set prequel is something of an origin ...

item.title: 'Venom' Is The Highest-Grossing Superhero Origin Movie Of All Time - Forbes
item.description:
'Venom' Is The Highest-Grossing Superhero Origin Movie Of All Time  Forbes

Sony’s superhero blockbuster Venom continues to take a big bite out of the box office, bolstered by some of the highest ticket sales in China for any superhero film ever released in the Middle Kingdom. With $822+ million and counting in its coffers, Venom has nearly $611 million from international markets and $211.7 million in domestic receipts. And after this weekend, it’s taken the crown for one particular sub-genre of superhero cinema. Official poster for Sony’s “Venom” Last year, Wonder Woman enjoyed a phenomenal theatrical run, including a massive $412.5 million domestic and $409 milli...

item.title: Does Marvel's Official Timeline Just Confuse Things More? - Forbes
item.description:
Does Marvel's Official Timeline Just Confuse Things More?  Forbes

The sequence of events is not always clear in Marvel’s ever expanding world (Photographer: Daniel Acker/Bloomberg). In 2008, we watched in awe as Iron Man took flight for the first time. Earlier this year, we watched that same character fly into space in Avengers: Infinity War. These two moments are separated by a whopping nineteen films that make up the epic saga that is the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). However, while fans may know the entire history of events by heart, the matter of an exact timeline gets confusing. Now, Marvel is trying to clear that up. As background, viewers initia...

item.title: ‘Avengers: Infinity War’ Coming To Netflix - International Business Times
item.description:
‘Avengers: Infinity War’ Coming To Netflix  International Business Times

After making over $2 billion at the box office, it seems like most people have seen “Avengers: Infinity War” by now, but understandably, they want to see it all again. It isn’t on any streaming service yet, but it is coming to Netflix soon. “Avengers: Infinity War” will hit Netflix on Dec. 25, so it’ll be a merry Christmas for Marvel fans. Netflix announced the arrival on Twitter with a Thanos gif. The film kicks off with the Avengers fractured after the events of “Captain America: Civil War,” but they all join the fight when Thanos (Josh Brolin) is after the Infinity Stones. The gems will ...

item.title: Into the Spider-Verse reviews round-up: What critics are saying about Marvel's new Spider-Man movie - The Independent
item.description:
Into the Spider-Verse reviews round-up: What critics are saying about Marvel's new Spider-Man movie  The Independent

The reviews are in for Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, and critics have raved about Marvel's animated reboot of the superhero's adventures. Far from the usual formula that saw Tobey Maguire, Andrew Garfield, and Tom Holland step into Spider-Man's suit in recent years, Into the Spider-Verse focuses on Miles Morales (voiced by Shameik Moore), a teenager of Puerto Rican and African-American descent who turns out to be one of several Spider-Men. Jake Johnson (best known as Nick Miller in New Girl) voices Peter Parker, who in this instance takes on the role of Morales's mentor. Spider-Ham (Jo...

item.title: Thanos' Brother Might Join The Marvel Cinematic Universe - Forbes
item.description:
Thanos' Brother Might Join The Marvel Cinematic Universe  Forbes

Thanos has siblings? We know little about Marvel’s plans beyond Avengers 4; they haven’t even given us one of those charts where they outline the next two decades of superhero movies. Not yet, anyway. But we do know that Spider-Man is going Far From Home, and that Black Panther is certainly getting a sequel because he made more than a billion at the box office. What exactly happens after the finger snap is a mystery, but it is suspected that the Marvel universe will expand into deep space, even without our favorite astronaut James Gunn. The depths of comic cosmology go pretty deep; The Cele...

item.title: Are the directors of ‘Avengers: Infinity War’ returning for Marvel’s ‘Secret Wars’? - NME Live
item.description:
Are the directors of ‘Avengers: Infinity War’ returning for Marvel’s ‘Secret Wars’?  NME Live

"Surprise them with casting choices, surprise them with story choices," Joe and Anthony Russo Avengers directors Joe and Anthony Russo have teased that they might not be finished with the MCU just yet. As fans continue to mull the possible collaborations that may arise from an anticipated deal between Disney and Fox, the pair have spoken about how they’re hopeful for the X-Men to arrive within the MCU, along with other “large-scale” crossovers. “[We] feel like the mission of the Marvel Universe is to keep expanding and surprising people. Surprise them with casting choices, surprise them wi...

item.title: Avengers 4 release date, trailer, title, spoilers – everything we know so far about Infinity War 2 - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4 release date, trailer, title, spoilers – everything we know so far about Infinity War 2  The Independent

Avengers: Infinity War brought about the destruction of the beloved superhero team. With Thanos looming large and half the Avengers turned to dust, anticipation for the as-yet-untitled sequel has reached fever pitch. Will Iron Man, Captain America and the remaining crew be able to put a stop to the Mad Titan? Can they bring back Spider-Man, Black Panther and Doctor Strange? Disney and Marvel have kept incredibly silent about the upcoming sequel, but small details have emerged thanks to tie-in toys, chatty actors and the occasional leak. Here’s everything we know about the fourth Avengers mo...

item.title: Avengers 4: Bucky actor Sebastian Stan still unsure if he will appear in new MCU film - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4: Bucky actor Sebastian Stan still unsure if he will appear in new MCU film  The Independent

If fans are feeling a little clueless as to the fate of their favourite heroes, they need not feel alone – the cast of Avengers 4 are just as baffled. Sebastian Stan, who plays Bucky Barnes in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, told Collider that he’s not actually sure he’s in the upcoming sequel to Avengers: Infinity War, as the films were shot simultaneously. “When I was shooting anything, nobody ever told me what was part one or part two,” he said. “The truth is, I don’t even know if I’m in [Avengers 4]. What I shot was in part one. And anything that I shot may or may not have been in part o...

item.title: Avengers 4: Two more characters confirmed as surviving Thanos’ Infinity War finger-snap - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4: Two more characters confirmed as surviving Thanos’ Infinity War finger-snap  The Independent

While the fate of several Marvel creations remains unknown following the shocking climax of Avengers: Infinity War, two characters have just had their living status confirmed. A brand new tie-in book from Brandon T Snider, titled Marvel’s Avengers: Infinity War: The Cosmic Quest, Volume 2: Aftermath (bit of a mouthful), has revealed that Thanos’ finger-snapping destruction may have wiped out half of the universe, but Dr Erik Selvig lives to fight another day. Alongside Selvig stands his associate Darcy Lewis, played in the Marvel Cinematic Universe by Kat Dennings. It’s Stellan Skarsgård wh...

item.title: Here's What's Coming To Netflix In December (2018) And What To Watch - Forbes
item.description:
Here's What's Coming To Netflix In December (2018) And What To Watch  Forbes

‘Avengers: Infinity War’ heads to Netflix on Christmas Day. With Turkey Day just around the corner, store shelves are already lined with Christmas decorations and retailers across the country are preparing for Black Friday and its assortment of clearance sales. We also have another long list of new TV shows, movies and Netflix Originals headed to the streaming service this December, including some very big releases—and no, I’m not talking about Bride of Chucky, though that scary movie is arriving next month just a tad late for Halloween. Fortunately, Netflix subscribers have plenty of great...

item.title: Aquaman first reactions call it 'best DC film since The Dark Knight' - The Independent
item.description:
Aquaman first reactions call it 'best DC film since The Dark Knight'  The Independent

Warner Bros has unveiled its standalone Aquaman film after what seems like an eternity of promotion. Despite making his debut in 2016 film Batman v Superman, the character – real name Arthur Curry – is only just receiving the solo treatment in a spectacle starring original Game of Thrones actor Jason Momoa, Amber Heard, Patrick Wilson, Nicole Kidman and, in what was originally a secret role, Julie Andrews. Compared with the Marvel Cinematic Universe, the majority of films released as part of the DC Extended Universe have had a fairly rough ride with the critics: Batman v Superman was malign...

item.title: Avengers 4 trailer and title announcement coming this week, predict Marvel fans - The Independent
item.description:
Avengers 4 trailer and title announcement coming this week, predict Marvel fans  The Independent

Marvel fans are sensing that huge Avengers news is on its way thanks to an Infinity War fan screening that will be attended by directors, the Russo brothers. The event – hosted by Collider – is taking place on Wednesday (28 November) with the directing duo set to take part in what is being billed as “a very special” Q&A. Considering the film is due to be released April 2019, fans believe it could be the perfect time to unveil a trailer or even a title. Read more - Stan Lee had already filmed his Captain Marvel and Avengers 4 cameos - Avengers 4 runtime is currently three hours - Two of Marv...

item.title: 'Avengers' director says Evans' Cap days may not be over - The Associated Press
item.description:
'Avengers' director says Evans' Cap days may not be over  The Associated Press

LOS ANGELES (AP) — Chris Evans suggested his run as Captain America is done. The filmmakers currently controlling the Avengers' fates say he shouldn't shelve the shield just yet. Evans tweeted last month that he had wrapped his shooting on the fourth "Avengers" movie, calling it an "emotional" day and saying, "Playing this role over the last eight years has been an honor." Joseph Russo, who along with brother Anthony wrote and directed this year's "Avengers: Infinity War" and next year's sequel, and directed Evans as Captain America in two previous films, told The Associated Press "I think ...

item.title: Stan Lee to Make Posthumous Cameo in ‘Avengers 4’ - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Stan Lee to Make Posthumous Cameo in ‘Avengers 4’  The Daily Beast

Gabriel Olsen / Getty Stan Lee was famous for performing brief (and often showstopping) cameos in films from the Marvel Universe he created, with walk-on parts in hundreds of movies and TV shows including X-Men (hot dog vendor), The Amazing Spider-Man (school librarian) and 2008’s The Incredible Hulk, in which he was credited as ‘Milwaukee man drinking from bottle.’ Now, it has emerged that Avengers 4 co-director Joe Russo previously said that Lee, who has died aged 95, had already filmed his Avengers 4 cameo at the time of his death, and will make a posthumous appearance in the movie, due ...

item.title: Stan Lee filmed Captain Marvel and Avengers 4 cameos before his death - The Independent
item.description:
Stan Lee filmed Captain Marvel and Avengers 4 cameos before his death  The Independent

Stan Lee filmed both his Avengers 4 and Captain Marvel cameos before he died. The comic-book writer - who created such iconic characters as Spider-Man, Black Panther, the Hulk, Doctor Strange, Thor, Iron Man, Daredevil, the Fantastic Four, and the X-Men - was taken to hospital on Monday morning (13 November) and died soon after. He was 95 years old. Lee was well-known to cinemagoers for appearing in multiple Marvel movies, including all 20 Marvel Cinematic Universe film released over the last decade. Director Joe Russo has previously confirmed Lee would appear in the upcoming untitled Aveng...

item.title: Sebastian Stan Filmed Fake Scenes For ‘Avengers’ Films - International Business Times
item.description:
Sebastian Stan Filmed Fake Scenes For ‘Avengers’ Films  International Business Times

The secrecy surrounding “Avengers 4” is at an all-time high with even the title still being withheld. The “Avengers: Infinity War” press tour featured stories of fake scripts and intense non-disclosure agreements. Now, Winter Soldier actor Sebastian Stan says he doesn’t even know if he is in the 2019 Marvel movie because he may have filmed scenes that were fake. “There were things that we shot that were never going to even make it because it was just easier to convolute the whole thing,” Stan told Collider, noting the great lengths Marvel went to in order to prevent spoilers from leaking. T...

item.title: Stan Lee Likely Filmed His 'Avengers 4' Cameo Role Prior To His Death - HuffPost
item.description:
Stan Lee Likely Filmed His 'Avengers 4' Cameo Role Prior To His Death  HuffPost

Captain America? Tony Stark? Thor? Stan Lee, the visionary pioneer behind the Marvel Comics universe, has been in more films than all of them combined. Lee died on Monday at the age of 95, but his much celebrated cameos likely haven’t ended, judging from an interview that “Avengers” co-director Joe Russo gave earlier this year. Speaking with the BBC in April just before the release of “Avengers: Infinity War,” Russo noted that Lee didn’t enjoy flying so Marvel productions that were shooting in similar locations would often film his cameos together. “Typically we try to get him out — he does...

item.title: Endless summer: Why Hollywood could nab its biggest box office year ever - CNN
item.description:
Endless summer: Why Hollywood could nab its biggest box office year ever  CNN

The US box office is on track to break records this year, crossing the $10 billion mark faster than ever before. Big films like Marvel's "Black Panther" and surprise hits like "A Quiet Place" have so far contributed to the massive domestic box office haul, which is 10.5% ahead of last year and 5.7% ahead of 2016's record year, according to ComScore. And there are still several months left in 2018. The hits came all year in 2018 and not just during the summer blockbuster months like most have in the past. "Black Panther," "Avengers: Infinity War" and "Venom" all set records at the box office...

item.title: Venom: Tom Hardy superhero film dominates China box office with huge $111m opening - The Independent
item.description:
Venom: Tom Hardy superhero film dominates China box office with huge $111m opening  The Independent

Venom has landed a huge $111m debut in China, making it the second biggest opening ever for a superhero film in the country, behind Avengers: Infinity War. The Marvel film currently stands at $674m worldwide, with projections the film may reach past $700m globally by the end of its cinematic run. It's also the best all-time opening for a Sony film in China. It follows Eddie (Tom Hardy), a reporter, who attempts to investigate what he suspects are experiments fatal to their test subjects, only to come into contact with an alien symbiote known as Venom, as it starts to take over. Read more - ...

item.title: Watch: Every Stan Lee cameo from every single Marvel movie he appeared in - Vox.com
item.description:
Watch: Every Stan Lee cameo from every single Marvel movie he appeared in  Vox.com

Marvel Lee’s work might not be well-known to every Marvel movie fan, but every fan knows how important Lee is to Marvel. Stan Lee, the godfather of Marvel comics, died on Monday, but his spirit will live on in the comic book characters he created, the adventures he took his readers on, and the imaginations he ignited. And of course, there are all those cameos. Lee has been a fixture in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), as well as in Sony and Fox’s Marvel superhero films since the studios began making mainstream blockbusters in the ’00s, briefly appearing onscreen in nearly every movie in...

item.title: 'Avengers 4' Co-Director Joe Russo Says We May Not See A Trailer This Year - HuffPost
item.description:
'Avengers 4' Co-Director Joe Russo Says We May Not See A Trailer This Year  HuffPost

Say it ain’t so, Joe. While participating in an Instagram Q&A session, Joe Russo, the co-director of Marvel’s highly anticipated and still-untitled “Avengers 4” film, revealed a bit of what to expect from the follow-up to “Infinity War.” The most surprising reveal during the interview might be when we’ll see a trailer. “You may or may not see it before the calendar turns 2019,” Russo said. The trailer for “Avengers: Infinity War” came out in November 2017, and the film was released April 27 (its original release date was May 4). Similarly, “Avengers 4″ is scheduled to come out May 3, 2019, ...

item.title: Stan Lee had already filmed ‘Avengers 4’ cameo and more prior to his death - NME Live
item.description:
Stan Lee had already filmed ‘Avengers 4’ cameo and more prior to his death  NME Live

The Marvel Comics mogul passed away yesterday (November 12) at the age of 95 Stan Lee Stan Lee had already filmed cameos in such upcoming films as Avengers 4 before his death, it has emerged. The writer and former president of Marvel Comics passed away yesterday (November 12) at the age of 95. A lawyer for Lee’s family confirmed his death, disclosing that Lee died after being admitted to the Cedars Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles for a medical emergency. - Read more: From the MCU and beyond – Every cameo Stan Lee made As well as his pioneering work in comics, Lee was also a pivotal figu...

item.title: Stan Lee’s 11 Best Cameos and Where to Stream Them - The New York Times
item.description:
Stan Lee’s 11 Best Cameos and Where to Stream Them  The New York Times

Stan Lee, the one-time editor in chief, publisher and chairman of Marvel Comics, died on Monday at age 95. Born Stanley Martin Lieber in New York City in 1922, Lee lived to see many of his comic-book creations take over the silver screen: Since 2008, the Marvel Cinematic Universe has churned out 20 films that have grossed over $17 billion worldwide. Lee had cameos in all of them, not to mention bit parts in other films, TV shows, and even video games, starting with a tiny role as a jury member in the 1989 TV movie, “The Trial of the Incredible Hulk.” (This YouTube video rounds up most of th...
